etymology.description: Depicts the shape of a suit of armor with overlapping plates
etymology.interpretation: The character 甲(甲) (jiǎ, 'armor') is a pictogram representing a stylized view of a suit of armor consisting of overlapping plates, suggesting protection and covering.

examples.chinese: 骑士穿戴甲(騎士穿戴甲)，保卫国家(保衛國家)。
examples.english: The knight dons the armor, defending the country.

examples.chinese: 古代兵士依靠甲(古代兵士依靠甲)，抵御强敌(抵禦強敵)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài bīngshì yīkào jiǎ, dǐyù qiángdí.
examples.english: Ancient soldiers relied on armor, repelling formidable enemies.
